The Personal Health column ''Fibromyalgia: Real Illness, Real Answers'' (Aug. 1) begins with the words, ''Is it a real disease?''
I have fibromyalgia and it is, indeed, a real disease, an illness without a cure. No one can understand or imagine what it is like to wake each morning with severe all-over pain that never goes away.
No one can understand what it is like to feel constantly as if you have the flu. No one can understand what it is like to be burning up one second and freezing the next.

No one can understand the loss of balance and walking into walls, doors and furniture. No one can understand the fear of forgetting and loss of memory. No one can understand how painful it is to feel like you are walking on hot coals and have pins and needles in your hands and feet. It is real.
